unnormalised: Urban planning in India requires a more holistic approach. The existing Master Plans often fail to address the needs of all citizens, particularly marginalized communities like those in Dharavi. We must prioritize sustainable development, referencing models like the Navi Mumbai project initiated on 26/01/1972. Infrastructure development needs serious investment, perhaps a Rs. 500 crore allocation. Local governance structures must be strengthened to handle issues at 17:00 hrs daily. The 74th Constitutional Amendment Act of 22/12/1992 provides a framework, but effective implementation remains a challenge. This requires skilled professionals from institutions like IIT Kharagpur. Focus on inclusive growth.
